title.narrative: Mitigating the Impact of COVID-19 Responses to Gov

description.narrative: The ‘‘Mitigating the Impact of COVID-19 Responses on Governance and Accountability Processes in Sierra Leone’’ project in Sierra Leone, implemented by Institute of Governance Reform (IGR) in partnership with Center for Accountability and the Rule of Law (CARL) aims to follow-up on how the Covid-19 response period has affected the implementation of the 2018 EOM recommendations including the potential to affect the overall electoral timelines and activities; the impact of the response on human rights, civil society space, accountability in governance and women’s voices and spaces. The objective of the project is to mitigate the impacts of Covid-19 on governance and accountability processes in Sierra Leone through identifying, monitoring and documenting key governance and accountability challenges and risks influenced by the Covid-19 outbreak and response. The key activities include periodic researches/surveys, production and dissemination of policy and analytical papers and engaging with relevant state and non-state institution/agencies.
